title: Newtons first law - determining the missing force

content.question: Three coplanar forces are exerted on an object which is at rest. Two of the forces are shown in the diagram. What is the magnitude of the third force if the object is to remain at rest?

choices.label: <math alttext="56.6 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>56.6</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="108 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>108</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="120 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>120</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="56.6 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>56.6</mn><mtext> N</mtext></mstyle></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
